detailed_results.question: What does NBR represent?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The National Board of Revenue (NBR) which is Highest executive tax authority in Bangladesh. A statutory body with the power to manage, control, and supervise the income tax department. The authority to make necessary rules concerning income tax matters.
detailed_results.prediction:
The National Board of Revenue (NBR) represents the highest executive tax authority in Bangladesh. Here are some key facts about NBR:

• It is a statutory body with the highest executive authority.
• It makes necessary rules relating to income tax, VAT, and customs duty.
• It has 15 classes of income tax authorities, ranging from NBR tax to non-NBR tax.
• Tax revenue accounts for 85% of government revenue in Bangladesh.
• NBR is empowered to make or amend rules concerning income tax matters.

detailed_results.question: What act is for co-operative societies?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The act related to co, operative societies is- The Companies Act, 1994 This act includes the co, operative society as a type of entity that is registered with the Companies Act.
detailed_results.prediction:
The Act for Co-operative Societies is the Cooperative Society Act, 2001. Here are some key details:

• The Act applies to Association of Persons registered under it.
• It covers income from agricultural activities, cottage industries, and other specific sectors (e.g., poultry feed, cattle farming, dairy farming).
• Income up to Tk 1,000,000 is taxed at 8%, while income above Tk 2,000,000 is taxed at 10%.
